tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

title.native: 夏目友人帳 漆 特別編

node.description:
Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
ADR Engineer at FUNimation Entertainment, however has since expanded to also being a Mixing Engineer.
